title: What is the relationship between alchemy and modern chemistry, and how does it relate to the concept of degeneracy?
first_phrase: In the preceding text, the author discusses the complexities surrounding alchemical literature and how a similar method used to decipher the "secret language" of the "Fedeli d'Amore" could be useful in understanding the often absurd and inconclusive concepts presented in alchemy. The author questions whether a different perspective might shed light on the impenetrable terminology used in alchemy. In this last part, the author concludes that modern historians may have a limited view of alchemy and that it encompasses a chemical aspect that is roughly accurate but fails to capture the true essence of alchemy.
content: Che l'alchimia comprenda altresì questo aspetto chimico e che nei riguardi di esso — ma di esso soltanto — sia approssimativamente esatta l'opinione dei moderni su di essa come pure sui suoi rapporti rispetto a ciò che è la chimica moderna — non pensiamo di contestarlo. Ma ciò che sfugge interamente ai moderni, è il senso che tale aspetto ha di fronte al lutto dell'alchimia, della vera alchimia.
last_phrase: In conclusion, while modern chemistry may accurately capture the chemical aspect of alchemy, it fails to grasp its true meaning and purpose as a cosmological and spiritual science with symbolic value. The degenerative nature of modern chemistry as an offshoot of true alchemy should be acknowledged rather than its evolution. Understanding the spiritual significance of alchemy can provide valuable insights for personal growth and spiritual development.
